CatDescriptText: Mrs. Barbara Cooks, 7111 Monticello Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1958, pg. 2, with question:�"Do you think that the numbers game should be legalized or outlawed?"� Answer reads: �"I feel that if the people want to play the numbers, they should be legalized. However, I don�t play them myself."�
TitMainTitle: Barbara Cooks wearing light colored coat and knit headband tied under chin, and Pittsburgh Courier reporter George Barbour standing on sidewalk at corner of Fifth Avenue and Liberty Avenue, Downtown
